page.title: 09HOMELIFE AND DAIRY FARMING
page.content: New Barn Farm has l97 acres & 108 dairy cows. Father-in-law had farmed the land as a tenant of Lord Shaftesbury since l932. Son-in-law purchased farm in 1976. Employs a dairyman. The{Milk Marketing Board} {take milk}which goes to Southampton & Bournemouth. 2 adults & 2 children in family. Wife helps on farm. School, shops, doctor in Cranborne (4 miles). A car is a must, so is telephone & freezer. New Barn Cottages are semi- detached, 1 occupied by farmworker, the other cottage owned by single lady who works in Poole. There are also 2 pairs of modernised semi-detached cottages occupied by 4 couples. All keen gardeners, growing vegetables, fruit & flowers. 1 husband is a deer stalker, 3 husbands commute. 2 cars per family. All have pets, phone & freezer, and cook by electricity.
